question_sentence: Another American community is reeling in the wake of a school shooting that occurred in which city this week?
evidence: Grief-stricken Nashville residents came together for a vigil Wednesday to mourn three 9-year-old children and three adults killed in the mass shooting at a private Christian school.

question_sentence: The Senate this week voted to end the national emergency declaration for which virus?
evidence: The final vote to end the Covid-19 emergency declared by then-President Donald Trump in March of 2020 was overwhelmingly bipartisan, 68-23. The joint resolution, which cleared the House earlier this year, now heads to President Joe Biden’s desk.

question_sentence: Which city was monitoring its drinking water system this week following a chemical spill upstream in the Delaware River?
evidence: Residents of Philadelphia rushed to buy bottled water after the city sent a mobile alert recommending people stop using tap water due to the spill. Officials have since said the city’s drinking water is safe to use.

question_sentence: Demand in the US surged for which flavored Girl Scout cookie, causing major inventory issues?
evidence: Due to high demand for the limited-edition Raspberry Rally cookie, scouts and parents were frequently forced to explain the shortage to annoyed shoppers.

question_sentence: Around what percentage of Americans tip at quick-service restaurants like coffee shops and pizza places?
evidence: Experts say Americans are tipping less – only around 16% – at quick-service establishments because they feel overwhelmed by options to tip with a card on a touchscreen, leading people to be less generous.

question_sentence: Which company announced it will begin making thousands of cuts to its workforce this week as part of a multibillion-dollar cost-cutting initiative?
evidence: The layoffs at Disney are set to impact about 7,000 jobs, CEO Bob Iger said this week.

question_sentence: Dozens of tech leaders, including Elon Musk, signed a letter this week calling on labs to temporarily stop developing which technology?
evidence: The tech leaders called for a pause in the “out of control” artificial intelligence race. The letter said AI labs are rushing to develop and deploy “ever more powerful digital minds that no one – not even their creators – can understand, predict, or reliably control.”

question_sentence: Which NFL star requested a trade from his longtime home this week?
evidence: It appears that Lamar Jackson, an MVP winner in 2019, is open to leaving his longtime home with the Baltimore Ravens. He requested a trade from the team this week.

question_sentence: Prince Harry and which famous musician are heading to court to sue a major UK newspaper publisher?
evidence: Both Prince Harry and Elton John were in court this week as a high-profile case against the publisher of the Daily Mail gets underway.

question_sentence: Frank Rubio is expected to break the record for the longest mission in space by a US astronaut. How many total days will he log in orbit before returning to Earth in September?
evidence: Rubio will have logged a total of at least 371 days in space, NASA officials said. The previous record of 355 days was set by Mark Vande Hei in 2022.

question_sentence: Which of these 2023 NCAA women’s basketball tournament participants did not advance to the Final Four?
Which major U.S. city will host the Final Four of the NCAA men’s basketball tournament this weekend?
Which iconic food brand will begin making use of a new logo this fall in the U.S. and Canada?
In a win for unions, which U.S. state saw its governor sign legislation repealing the right-to-work law that was in place?
True or false: Kelly Clarkson will be releasing a new album this year and performing in a Las Vegas residency this summer.
choices: False. She is just doing the residency.
False. She is doing neither and just focusing on her TV show.

question_sentence: Which legendary musical revival opened on Broadway this week?
choices: “Sweeney Todd: The Demon Barber of Fleet Street”

question_sentence: The former CEO of which company testified Wednesday during a Senate hearing on the treatment of employees who are unionizing?
A cell-based meat company resurrected the extinct woolly mammoth in the form of:
Which U.S. state saw its governor sign legislation that will provide free school meals to all students regardless of family income?
The Sacramento Kings officially ended the longest playoff drought of any U.S. major pro sports team. When did they last make the postseason?
Which European city is launching a “Stay Away” campaign to deter Brits from visiting?
evidence: Internet users in Britain who use search phrases such as “stag party Amsterdam” are being targeted with pop-up videos warning of the consequences of getting drunk and rowdy in the Dutch capital.

question_sentence: Why is a Dutch sperm donor who is alleged to have fathered more than 550 children being sued?
choices: For not disclosing a genetic health condition
For increasing the risk of incest
For donating other men’s sperm under his name
evidence: Jonathan Jacob Meijer is facing a lawsuit brought by the Netherland’s DonorKind Foundation on behalf of 25 families who claim he may have increased the risk of accidental incest and inbreeding by defying guidelines limiting sperm donations.

question_sentence: Why did Prince Harry make a surprise appearance in London this week?
choices: To rehearse his role in King Charles’s coronation
For relationship-building talks with Prince William
evidence: The California-based royal attended hearings in a lawsuit that he and other high-profile figures – including Elton John, Liz Hurley and Sadie Frost – have brought against Associated Newspapers Limited for alleged privacy breaches.

question_sentence: Residents in which country moved their clocks forward last weekend to Daylight Saving Time for the last time?
evidence: Greenland’s parliament voted to stick to Daylight Saving Times in order to give people in the Danish semi-independent territory more time in the afternoon to do business with Europe and North America. Find out more with The Week Unwrapped podcast.

question_sentence: Humza Yousaf won the second round of the SNP leadership election with what percentage of the vote?
evidence: The former health secretary beat rival Kate Forbes in the battle to replace Nicola Sturgeon as leader of the Scottish National Party, after Ash Regan was eliminated in the first-round ballot of party members.

question_sentence: A company that specialises in lab-grown meat has unveiled a meatball created from the DNA of which extinct species?
evidence: Australian firm Vow has previously created lab-grown meat from the cells of animals including alpacas, buffalo and kangaroos, and used DNA from the extinct Ice Age species to show how far the boundaries of cultured meat may be pushed.

question_sentence: Vladimir Putin has announced plans to station Russian nuclear weapons in which neighbouring country?
evidence: Ukraine accused Moscow of holding Belarus “as a nuclear hostage” after the Russian president threatened to station tactical nuclear weapons in the neighbouring nation, and Nato condemned his “dangerous and irresponsible rhetoric”.

question_sentence: Tory MP James Wild has suggested doing what to help prevent littering?
choices: Adding warnings on packaging about the environmental impact of litter
Increasing the number of public recycling bins
Printing customers’ licence plates on takeaway food wrappers
evidence: The MP for North West Norfolk outlined his proposal to The Telegraph following a law change that allows councils to issue the keeper of a vehicle from which litter is thrown with a civil penalty, rather than having to prove who discarded the rubbish. Ministers are “currently cool on the plan”, according to the newspaper.

question_sentence: Tech experts and execs including Elon Musk have called for artificial intelligence development to be paused for how long, amid fears of a threat to humanity?
evidence: Tesla tycoon Musk and Apple co-founder Steve Wozniak are among more than 1,000 signatories of an open letter arguing that work on “giant AI experiments” should be paused until “we are confident that their effects will be positive and their risks will be manageable”.

question_sentence: What is the name of the UK government’s new plan to deliver net zero by 2050?
evidence: The revised strategy includes dozens of measures ranging from increasing UK wind, solar and nuclear energy to investing in carbon capture and storage.
